name: Polandball: Can into Space!
description: Crazy fun rocket simulator game with countryballs theme. Can Polandball into Space? Try to find out!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 and above Processor: Intel Core i3 @ 2.00 GHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: Intel HD Graphics 4000 DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 700 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 and above Processor: Intel Core i5 @ 2.00 GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Intel HD Graphics 4000 DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 1 GB available space

reviews.review_text: Funny game with a simple plot and gameplay. But still it's possible spend couple of hours: flying, farming and completing achievements. For the passage of the game you will see a short cartoon. If you have a problem or question - just ask at steam forum and get fast answer.  GJ, APS.

I had the pleasure of playing this game for free but would have been happy to pay the small price for this awesomely addictive game!  Based on the Countryball comic web series this game follows Polandball, a hard done by Countryball, picked on and bullied by the other Countryballs. To show the other balls who's boss, he decides to build himself a spaceship to make it to the moon!  Upgrade your ship for stability, power and to resist damage. Collect money and fuel as you fly through the sky to show those other balls who's got the biggest...ego.  A big game for a small price.
Its not really an accurate simulation game but still fun.
Game is a lot of fun if you're a fan of polandball comics I would recommend it to anyone who is a fan of them.

Fun game to play, it looks good and it all fits well with the theme.

On one hand, it's actually pretty fun, with surprisingly good graphics and music. On the other hand, the upgrade system is awkward, progression is slow and linear, and nothing says professional quite like a Unity Personal splash screen.  It's $3 and it's Polandball*. Go for it.  *I'm not sure who, if anyone, owns the rights to this, so if you want this game I'd get it while you still can.

It was a pleasant suprise to find a game about a meme so close to my heart, but what I did not expect is that this game awakened a xenophobic salt beast that was bubbling under the surface of my skin. Seriously, ♥♥♥♥ Belgium, they can peddle on their little bike over to me to suck my ♥♥♥♥, but they'll have to wait in line behind Romania, Scotland and Serbia.  The game itself is quite fun.
